body_content.explanation: (of an area) not having enough water:
examples: The article warned that two-thirds of the world's population will live in water-stressed countries by 2025.
He said that the public would not tolerate high levels of leakage in water-stressed areas.

body_content.explanation: (of plants) not able to grow normally because they do not get the right amount of water, usually too little water:
examples: Chronically water-stressed plants are more susceptible to attack by insects and diseases.
If plants are water stressed during the summer, they may experience severe problems during the rest of the year.
